campaign.story:
About Project 562
Last December, I sold everything in my Seattle apartment, packed a few essentials into my war pony, and hit the open road. Since then, I’ve been embarking on an epic adventure: Project 562.
For the past year I have been fulfilling the project’s goal of photographing citizens of each federally recognized tribe in the United States (there are now 566). Most of the time, I’ve been invited to geographically remote reservations to take portraits and hear stories from a myriad of tribes, while at other times I've photographed members of the 70 percent of Native Americans living in urban settings. My hope, is that when the project is complete, it will serve to educate the nation and shift the collective consciousness toward recognizing our own indigenous communities.
Imagine walking through an exhibit and realizing the complex variety of contemporary Native America. Imagine experiencing a website or book, that offered insight into every Tribal Nation in the United States. What if you could download previously untold histories and stories from Apaches, Swinomish, Hualapai, Northern Cheyenne, Tlingit, Pomo, Lumbee, and other first peoples? What if you had heard those stories in grade school? 
Project 562 is making all this happen.
With Your Support 
This is Project 562's second Kickstarter campaign for critical funding for our second year on the road. Your help covering the ongoing expenses for transportation, film, administration, lodging, and meals will keep Project 562 strong and on target.
Rewards
We are delighted to offer wonderful "reward" items for this year's Kickstarter. We've partnered with noted Native American fashion designer and artist Bethany Yellowtail for limited edition couture pieces along with original sweatshirts, spirit tees, sweater dresses, and Project 562 posters.We hope you’ll be as pleased as we are with these unique, attractive acknowledgements of your support.
Project 562 Poster
Official 11x14 Project 562 Poster, featuring Darkfeather, Eckos and Bibiana Ancetta from the Tulalip Tribe.
Official Team Spirit Tee of Project 562
The Spirit Tee's offer original Project 562 photographs and are available in size s-xl. Contributors are be able to choose one of three options:
1. Black & White with Starr 2. Slate & White with Cedar 3. Turqoise & White with Canoe Journey Dancer.
Mens Hoodie and Project 562 T-Shirt
562 Ladies Hoodie
In true Matika fashion, we’re offering you a sweatshirt that you can rock with boots (it’s not just a hoodie, it’s a dress). Offered in turquoise and grey. One size only.
B. Yellowtail for Project 562
PLAY

Bethany Yellowtail, fashion designer, stylist, and motivational speaker from the Crow and Northern Cheyenne Tribe has partnered with us to assist in fundraising efforts for Project 562.  In this very exciting collaboration, Yellowtail has transformed Project 562 photography into one-of-a-kind textile prints. She has created three, limited edition couture pieces that will serve as gifts to the generous contributors of Project562:
Yellowtail Shift Dress
This original photographic silky textile by Matika Wilbur has been transformed by B.Yellowtail into a luxurious, dainty shift dress. Available in peach or cream, size xs-xxl.
All Our Relations Crew Neck
Designed by B.Yellowtail, this “vegan” leather crew neck represents the Tribal Nations that Matika will visit; a walking dedication to all of our relations. Available in xs-xxl.
"Paddle To Quinalt" Dress
B.Yellowtail Kaftan featuring Matika Wilbur Photography from the 2013 Canoe Journey. This elegant, hand beaded dress, showcases Quinalt women dancing on the shores of the Olympic Coast in Washington State, welcoming Canoe’s from several Tribal Nations. Available in xs-xxl.
 Original image:
Why Project 562
Project 562 creatively addresses and remedies historical inaccuracies, stereotypical representations, and the absence of Native American images and voices in mass media and the national consciousness.  I believe that there is an open space that is yet to be filled- that space is authentic images and stories from within Native America. My work aims to humanize, the otherwise “vanishing race”, and share the stories that our people would like told. In this respectful way, I have been welcomed into hundreds of tribal communities, and I have found that people welcome Project 562, because they are ready to see things change. Conversations about tribal sovereignty, self-determination, wellness, recovery from historical trauma, and revitalization of culture will accompany the photos in captions, video, and audio recordings. 
The time of sharing, building cultural bridges, abolishing racism and honoring the legacy that this country is built on is among us. Project 562 is that platform.
Matika Discusses Project 562 at TED
 Watch Our Road Stories
Project 562 in The Media
NBC: Native American Travels Across U.S. Photographing Citizens of Tribal Nations
Seattle's Stranger: Shooting and Capturing: Matika Wilbur's Fierce Fight Against A Hundred Years of Native American Photography
Fusion: You've Never Seen Native America Like This
Indian Country Today: Photographer Matika Wilbur's Three Year, 562 Tribe Adventure
Become A Project 562 Ambassador
The Project 562 Team is currently looking for Ambassadors that can assist with important tasks, including 2014 fundraising efforts; social media outreach; general outreach to tribal communities; educational lecture series outreach; and media outreach. We are also seeking new Interns for 2014.If you are interested in volunteering, or in applying to our intern program, please email: jessica@project562.com.
Matika will be visiting a community near you. In advance she is humbly seeking your guidance, input, and involvement in this very important and timely project. Matika would like to photograph elders, culture bearers, community leaders, artists, storytellers, and youth. If you would like to recommend someone to be photographed in your community, please email: m@matikawilbur.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The last year has shown risks and challenges that I couldn't have anticipated: First, the RV that I secured turned out to be a leaky disaster, so I had to take my two-seater Honda instead (funny thing, RV dealers won't lend to artists without a "real job"). Then, after two months on the road, my bestie/companion/assistant decided that "road life" wasn't for her (I completely get it, sleeping on people's couches isn't glamorous, and I love her for coming at all). Nonetheless, I had to find the courage to forge the road alone. 

And even though I consider myself a Road Warrior, the road has worn on my spirit, and the constancy of travel has required an endurance that I didn't know that I was capable of. I have found a new strength; I didn't realize that all of the work I’ve done in the past (photo school, commercial photographer, international journalist, at-risk tribal youth teacher and visual literacy professor) would lead to Project 562, but without the accumulation of those experiences, I wouldn’t have the strength, knowledge, and courage to plunge onward into a multi-year national photography project.

I have to tell you, I didn't anticipate that I would need to do a second fundraising campaign. I believed that if I applied for enough grants, one of them would say yes. Over the last year, I applied for 26 artists grants, even though I did receive 4 of them (thank-you), I was told by the others that, "I am a risky investment". Grantors see Project 562 as an improbable feat, and institutions don't want to give their money to risky artists.

That being said, I want you to know that I am progressing mightily despite institutional disbelief. I have been inspired by the “kindness of strangers” I have encountered. I have been motivated by the hope and light I see in the eyes of students and other youth I speak with. I have been rejuvenated by the kindness of the stranger's that I have encountered. I have been restored by the hope that I see in the eyes of students that I speak with.

I had this incredible experience at the bottom of The Grand Canyon. The elders appointed a teenage boy to help me carry my equipment to photo shoots (since there aren't cars down there, and I'm clumsy on a horse). He was kind of quiet at first, standoffish even. But after the first interview and photoshoot, he was excited for the next one. He started suggesting ideas. I could see him listening as we spoke to his elders. That evening, he revealed that he had walked a despairing path, having struggled with depression and his own sense of Tribal identity. As I was leaving, he shyly pulled me aside, and told me that this project gave him a new sense of hope. He said that he believed in me. He said that I was the first lady that he'd ever met that had went on to "do something". He thanked me for giving him hope. He said that his experience with Project 562 had meant more to him than he could articulate. 

I repeatedly have experiences like the one in the Grand Canyon. Those experiences give me the strength to keep going; I genuinely believe that Project 562 will help to shift our collective consciousnesses toward respectfully recognizing the beauty of contemporary Native America.

I know challenges lie ahead (and many, many miles), but I feel blessed with spirit and armed with the skills and tools to tackle them, whatever they may be. Your faith and help are all important. T'igwicid.

Hello Friend!
I write to you from my window seat 10k feet above land aboard Alaska Airlines flight 355. I don't know why, but it's always easier to write to you from these seats...
I'm heading to the Oakland airport, where I'll catch the Bart to UC Berkeley. Tomorrow morning I'll connect with students and encourage the paradigm shift we so desperately need. I'll discuss native identity with them, I'll share about my adventures and setbacks, and I'll encourage them to be brave, and maybe, hopefully, be inspired. That's the goal of tomorrow morning’s presentation. As of late, there have been so many presentations. I gave a keynote at the National Indian Education Association, at a highly secretive government agency, and at more universities than I can name. 2015 was so grand.... I moved into the "Big Girl" and learned how to live inside a 22-foot home that requires the dumping of #1's & 2's once a week, has a tiny-tiny shower, and has the capacity to make coffee while cruising down some straight-away. I received invitations to the White House and countless Rez houses. I made the best of friends; sojourned below the sea in Hawaii, climbed trees in Akwesasne, rode airboats in the Everglades, and crisscrossed the country (twice).

campaign.story:
Who am I?
I'm a storyteller, I always have been. I started writing at ten, teaching myself to touch type as well as how to use computers. Twenty three years later I'm an Apple girl (purely because of the accessibility options, honest) who swears by Scrivener, Aeon Timeline and Dropbox.
On a good day I can be found tapping away, on a bad one - caused by chronic anaemia - I can hardly get out of bed, much less leave the house which is where my iMac comes in. I worked as a freelance journalist for nearly a decade before my worsening vision and health problems forced me to realise I'm no longer able to work. 
I've always been visually impaired and this is no more obvious by the number of blind characters who crop up in my stories. In my case I have retinopathy of prematurity due to being born at twenty four weeks which left me with white matter damage to my brain from too much oxygen, a blind right eye and a blurry left one. I also have Asperger's though that can sometimes be more of a boon than a bane, especially when it comes to research. Three years ago I qualified with my lovely guide dog, Unis, and she serves me very well, allowing me to go out safely as well as keeping me company while I write.
The dynamic duo; Uni and Lesley
For nearly a decade I freelanced for everyone - seriously, the list is as long as my arm - from anime magazines like NEO and Newtype USA to games publications including Kotaku and Official Xbox Magazine to newspapers like the Eastern Daily Press and The Guardian. Now I am recreating myself as an author, specifically focusing on science fiction and urban fantasy.
I'm in the prime of life, apparently, so being retired as due to my disabilities is incredibly frustrating as I would love to work and put my skill sets to good use. Right now I'm trying to be proactive by doing lots of writing and I do stints writing novels or poetry and short or serial fiction. However there's a particular project I want to get beyond drafting and actually publish. 
About The Changing of the Sun
My magnum opus is the Ashterai Chronicles, a multi-work tale of the future and the past set on many worlds but principally Earth, Mnemosyne (a twilight world which serves as the seat for a governmental body called the Union) and the sun-kissed world of Coronis (known simply as Ishvei's World to the inhabitants). The Changing of the Sun is the first in a trilogy focusing on Coronis, one of the Union's founding worlds, and sees the planet weathering a massive solar storm which could end civilisation as it is known - but for a simple, forbidden prophecy that refuses to die. 
The other two books in the trilogy The Water Children and The Calling will follow in 2015.
This is my temporary cover for The Changing of the Sun, the first of a trilogy set on an alien world being ravaged by a solar storm. The actual cover will be much more awesome and done by artist extraordinaire JASON GURLEY
A religious planet, Ishvei's World - or Coronis to the people of Earth - is led by its Oracles. Blind and guided by the whisperings of their Disembodied Goddess, they shepherd the sun-kissed Kashinai tribes and clans towards the future, warning of any catastrophes or trials so that the people might prepare themselves. 
Traditionally the mantle of High Oracle is given to any blind woman who has a vision of the future and can pass a secret test. During The Changing of the Sun, this mantle is held by Jashri but her time is ending and that of Saiara is about to begin.
Saiara's vision is one unlike any other Oracle has seen since Kaiene, the first to hold the title. She sees the anger of their star, Thaeos, as he focuses his rage on their tiny planet. She passes the Test and should be High Oracle but instead finds herself imprisoned and her lover banished from the city to an obscure, forgotten religious order.
Forced to fight for her life and those of the people who believe her, Saiara must guide them to the sacred Canhei Basin where they can weather the storm in safety. But she's not alone, true heroes never are as we follow not just her journey but those of others around her, including the mysterious Jeiana, a woman indwelt by an entity who is definitely not Kashinai.
Map of Reskha: Before the Changing of the Sun (Created by Rob Antonishen of http://www.cartocopia.com)
Want to know more?
You can also check out my Pinterest mood board for the trilogy by clicking here and read a sample of the first couple of chapters below.
The Changing of the Sun is around 120k in length and here's the official blurb:
Those chased by destiny do not always run to its embrace - Kaiene the Blessed, first Oracle of Aia
Saiara never wanted to be the High Oracle, much less a seer. Jeiana never expected to wake up when the wave took her and Casparias never thought he would be banished for doing his duty.
On the ancient world of Coronis, the days are getting hotter, the baelish are dying in the fields and no rain is falling. Something is wrong and the entire continent of Reskha can sense it but only the High Oracle of Aia has the power to voice their suspicions.
The eye of Thaeos, their solar deity, is falling upon their world and his gaze means fire and death. The Changing of the Sun is upon them.
Saiara finds herself in a battle for not just hearts and minds but souls when she is given a vision of a cataclysmic solar event about to rock their planet. Sanctuary exists but time is running short and she is trapped against her will in a gilded prison ruled by her predecessor. Can she escape and find safety before Thaeos turns his rage upon their world and what will she have to sacrifice to save the people who love her?
Why am I doing a Kickstarter?
I live on a fixed-income which is rather tiny. I could pay for all these things but it would take fives times as long plus I might have to give up eating. I want to see a book published in the next twelve months and this is the best way to see that happen.
What is the money for?
Editing the book to make it publishable.
Seriously, though I'm a qualified journalist, this is actually much harder than it seems. This makes an editor THE most important part of the process, someone who can help me polish the story a thing of beauty and not a pile of rubbish. Fortunately I have a brilliant editor lined up and I am, of course, insisting on giving him money for his time.
Designing a professional cover 
You know that adage 'never judge a book by it's cover'? Well it's a load of BS, I judge books by their covers all the time and I'm sure everyone else does too. 
My Photoshop skills are woeful so I asked Jason Gurley - whom you may know not only as a writer (he's the author of Greatfall and Eleanor) - but also as the guy who designs covers for Hugh 'bestselling author of Wool' Howey) to do all the covers for all three books as well as as well as laying out the text.
I chose Jason because he makes truly awesome covers ... (seriously, go look, now!) He could and probably should be employed by some of the best publishers on the market but instead he freelances and I'm blessed to have caught him and had him accept the commission.
Here are some of my favourite Jason Gurley covers to give you an idea why I want him so badly.
So why are you paying for three covers? If things go well, The Water Children and The Calling will be unlocked as stretch goals! Plus, because this series a trilogy, it makes sense to get all three covers done by the same person and at the same time.
e-book
Yep, it's the obvious format. An e-book will be made available in various formats (.epub/.pdf/.mobi) and sent to backers later in the year.
The costs of the various rewards
Mugs, art cards and posters will all cost money and this is something that final amount has to include.

Kickstarter and Amazon's fees.
Kinda obvious but if I reach my goal, Kickstarter get a percentage and so do Amazon for processing the payments. Go figure. 
Backer Bonus!
Inspired by the sheer amount of support I've gotten since putting this project live, once we get to 50% a bonus e-book will be unlocked for all backers who pledged £15 (Kadian) or more!
This is what unlocks at 50% for delivery when the project funds!
A prelude to the first novel in the series "The Whispers in the Desert" focuses on how a potter's daughter becomes an unlikely tyrant when rulership of an entires species unexpectedly sees her elevated to the highest position in the land.
The novella is around 26k and includes cameos by Eirian, Jashri, Kadian, Beren, Meresia and Taras of the Edoi and various other characters. It also includes exclusive extracts from Jashri's biography by the noted Kashinai theologian Mother Elyn London, who first appears in The Water Children.
This e-book be exclusive to my backers until Changing is released. You don't need to read the novel and actually this should help introduce the world of Coronis. Be warned, this is not a happy story but it is one which cried out to be told.
Stretch Goals!
Let's imagine, for a minute, that everything goes swimmingly. I don't want to be greedy but what is the point of a Kickstarter without some incentives to go further?
Before I begin, this is important: Even if I only just hit my goal, even if none of the stretch goals are met, the second and third books will still come along, it will just take a bit more time.
With that in mind:
£2000 - The Changing of the Sun print edition
I want a print run, I really do; Jason Gurley covers demand it and so this is the first stretch goal. Anyone who pledges £15 or more will get one.
£2500 and £3000 - The Water Children
If we hit £2500, The Water Children will be unlocked in e-book. Everyone who gives over £15 will get a copy and massive kudos.
If the project hits £3000, the print edition of The Water Children will be unlocked. Everyone who gives over £15 and requested a print copy will get one.
In the interests of honesty, The Water Children is at 30k, I expect the first draft to be finished by June. I hope to have it published by Christmas 2014.
Here's the temporary cover for The Water Children. I promise the final version will be much more shiny!
Here the blurb for the book:
The ocean is eternal; as deep as the heart, as clear as the soul. Within it all secrets hidden will, one day, be found - A Seaborn adage, author unknown
Centuries after The Changing of Sun and Coronis is a different world. Seas have risen, lands have changed and against all odds the children of Ishvei have survived great adversity.
Jannah the Pious has led the diaspora of clans back from Canhei and, from the new-born capital of Kasan, has instructed archeologists to travel to the ruins of the great cities, to Ossoi and the ruins of Danshu, to retake the unexplored south and resettle the hubs of civilisation left to the ravages of time.
Free-diver An'she and her twin, atheist Sarai have been assigned to the team investigating Danshu and the drowned ruins of Aiaea. Touched by forces neither can understand, Sarai is terrified of the water and haunted by the songs of the Water Children that torment her every waking moment. An'she, on the other hand, relishes her chance to use her talents and finds a strange familiarity in the water-swamped streets of the sunken city.
Neither woman knows, however, that they are being watched by more than one pair of eyes. Deep below Danshu, the Forgotten Ones are preparing for the annual rituals of the Falling and the Rising when matured Seranoa begin their pilgrimage in the ocean of space. Above Ishvei's World, alien eyes are watching and no one quite expects the cataclysmic collision which leaves Kella, daughter of the ship's captain, stranded on an alien world with no way home.
Through the eyes of the sons and daughters of Ishvei it is time to return to a world much changed, as secrets are revealed and the Water Children Rise.
£3500 and £4000 - The Calling
If we hit £3500, the e-book of the final book, The Calling, will be unlocked! Everyone who gives over £15 will get a copy and massive kudos. 
If the project hits £4000, the print edition of The Calling will be unlocked. Everyone who gives over £15 and requested a print copy will get one.
And here's The Calling cover ... Again, it's purely to give you something to look at. The final cover will be awesome.
Here's the blurb:
We are all - regardless of world of birth or creed - brothers and sisters in the great kishai - Kashinai proverb, author unknown
Ishvei's World endures, the glittering jewel of the Union crown, yet has been without an Oracle, a Voice of Aia, for a generation. After Contact with a world named Earth, this peaceful planet has become a battlefield for souls and all Esca wants is to go home, to the planet she was born on.
Spirited away by the previous Oracle's daughter, Esca is the only survivor of an incident so terrible it has rocked both Earth and Coronis to their cores. Sequestered in the temple in the melting-pot of Kasan for her own protection, Esca must tell the greatest of lies to save her own life. As family chase her across the stars, as relations with Earth begin to fray, Esca must choose between the family she has chosen and the one she was born into, life and death and a role that she does not want to play.
The first draft of The Calling is done (I know, weird right?) It needs at least two more drafts, one including a perspective change. It currently stands at 100k and I'm aiming to have it done by late summer and published in early 2015.
Thank you!
Crowd-funding is about making dreams reality. Mine is small but precious to me and I can't wait to bring you along on what promises to be a roller-coaster as we go from final draft to publication. Thank you for reading my pitch, for backing or just for spreading the word.

campaign.story:
Whether you love your grandparents, neighbors or Betty White, it's undeniable that our elders rock and they need us. Let's delight them, plus your other friends, family, co-workers and more, together.
There's a reason the saying "Oldies but goodies" exists. Elders are society's greatest treasure-- they support us, share their wisdom, and give us unconditional love. They bridge us to the past, and impact generations to come. They teach us to read, bake us cookies, play cards with us, show us how to knit, and make our lives richer. But, as we grow older, too often we get too wrapped up in our busy lives to keep in touch with them consistently, when it really matters. Even a simple hello can make all the difference when an elder is bored, hurting or lonely.
After talking with my Oma and her friends, I've designed a product I think elders will love, based on their feedback that even simple ongoing communication from their families can enrich their lives. I'm making it easy for you to keep in touch with your grandparents and anyone else you'd like, through these awesome Kickstarter rewards. Don't worry about forgetting to send something, keeping track of dates, trying to remember addresses, going to the store to shop for cards, or running to the post office- I've got your back. You can improve the life of someone you care about by backing this project today!
 When you support this project, I'll make sure your favorite person receives:
Personalized communication from you. I'll help you write the perfect card. I'll design it beautifully, print it clearly so that elders can easily read it, sign it for you, and prompt you with questions to answer, so I can send a heartfelt message with news from you.
&
Goods they'll love. I'll print three 4x6 photos you provide (or 4x4 photos if you'd like to use photos from Instagram), and depending upon the plan you select, occasionally include cool bonus treats like organic tea, photo-magnets and more (if you choose this reward you get to vote, and the most popular good will be included!)
1. Pick the reward you want to send. Just select how often you'd like to keep in touch with your elder.
2. Give me the details. I'll compose a personal note from you on the exclusive card I've designed, by prompting you with questions, and remind you to provide me with three photos, every month via email.
3. Smile. I'll create your gift, ship it and delight your favorite elder.
I'll create and provide a nice mix of types of cards for your elder, without any branding, so it truly looks like their gift came right from you. This project is the only way anyone can gain access to these exclusive card designs! I hope to team up with independent designers, each for a series of six.
I've already developed a series of greeting cards, created with photographer Lisy McIntee, that sweeps elders on an adventure around the world, featuring the stunning slopes of the Rockies, the calm of a quiet morning in Germany, a brilliant sunset on the Golden Coast, and beyond. And, the other series I've already created showcases original hand-drawn illustrations by me. Here are just a few examples of the cards your favorite elders might receive (more are in the works, so each month I'll select the perfect card to send):
Photo series greeting card
Photo series greeting card

Plus, just let me know your person's birthday date if it falls within your subscription, and I'll send them a birthday card instead of the normal card that month! And, because I truly want to do everything possible to help you make the lives of everyone you love better...
You can even download it for FREE here (once you're on the page just right-click to save the image)! Print it out on a card to send to them (works up to 5x7 size), or send a quick email their way with it embedded.
Hand illustrated birthday card
I'll print off three 4x6 photos you provide (or 4x4 if you prefer Instagram photos) and include them with the card.
I'll include a surprise good in one of your sends to delight the person of your choice, if you pick the year-long reward. (If you choose this reward you get to vote between tea, photo-magnets and more, and the most popular good will be included!)
Photo-Magnet (High-quality print 2 inches x 2 inches)
The images from the cards sent out each month, but as flat .jpgs and via email. That way you still get access to the one-of-a-kind designs as I release them each month, and you can print them out on your own card stock or send them on via email to your favorite elder. Plus, I'll be reminding you to keep in touch on a regular basis!
Don't worry, if you'd like to support the movement but there's no one you want to keep in touch with, I've still got something for you...
A short message from this special elder could be all yours!
I'm raising money to support my dream of improving grandparents' and every elder's quality of life. My goal is to impact 500+ elders directly through this Kickstarter project. Some of the many costs involved include:
A great quality printer for photos and cards: $999
Photo-paper: $20/100
Ink: $60/100
Greeting cards: $20/100
Letterpress plates: $100
Envelopes and postage: $100/100
Paying independent designers to team up for one-of-a-kind card lines: $100+/design
A Web site, hosting, url, developer and designer: $1000+ (I'd like to integrate the site with Instagram and/or Facebook so eventually you can just tag photos and we'll know to print those out for that month. And, potentially even integrate with SMS or create an app so you can do everything on the go.)
My great-grandparents helped my parents raise me, and made me who I am today, and I have so many wonderful memories of our times together.
During college I was on a sports team and was featured on a poster advertising our upcoming events that season. To help spread the word, our coach volunteered to send the posters to anyone we'd like, on our behalf. I had one sent to my great-grandparents, and within two weeks I received an amazing handwritten card back from them-- thanking me for sending the poster, telling me how much they loved it, and including $5 so I could treat myself and my roommate to some ice cream! And, the next time I went to visit my great-grandparents, they took me right upstairs to show off the bedroom corner where the poster was proudly displayed. This experience made me realize what a huge impact something so little could have on the life of a grandparent, parent or any elderly person.
After that, I vowed to do a better job keeping in touch, but always found myself "too busy" (aka watching Netflix, sleeping, going shopping with friends, etc) to go to a convenience store for a card, write a note, remember the right address and mail it, or too overwhelmed by the thought of picking up the phone-- and days turned into weeks which turned into months. Anyhow, now it's too late for me and my great-grandparents, as they have both gone on to a better place, which is what inspired me to start this project. My great-grandparents deserved something more from me and I let them down. I want do better for my other grandparents before it's too late, and for you and yours.
Join me in making and keeping a New Years resolution that really matters.
While my face might be a bit deceiving, I swear I loved these two.
In loving memory of my Mom Mom and Pop Pop.
THANK YOU so much for your support and interest! Please like us on Facebook and help spread the word by sharing this project. Get involved in the movement by sharing your memories, stories and photos of the elders you care about on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and more using the hashtag #oldiesbutgoodies! Bloggers, support this Kickstarter on your blog and let us know, and we'll send you a FREE 3 month subscription (a $25 value!) for you or for one of your fans (as long as we meet our funding goal)!
HUGE THANKS to my good friends Nick Baker and Tristan Klein (winner's of Tropfest New York) for my Kickstarter video. If you like the work of this impressive duo be sure to check out their website: www.seekandhide.com.au and get in touch about any projects: admin@seekandhide.com.au.

SMART SLEEP MASK- LAST MINUTE OFFER $165!- the price will never be so low!!
EUROPEAN 1ST AWARD 
FOR THE BEST STARTUP IN 2013 GOES TO
INTELCLINIC NEUROON!!
Are you looking for the perfect Christmas gift? Check our new Christmas reward! 
TODAY YOU HAVE THE LAST CHANCE TO GET YOUR CHRISTMAS REWARD! 
You can order it until Tuesday 17.12.13 3PM PST. 
[Image removed by Kickstarter]
What is the NeuroOn?
NeuroOn is the world’s first brainwave - monitoring SLEEP MASK that allows you to switch from monophasic to polyphasic sleep. That means you can sleep less and more efficiently.
Wake up!
Do you ever feel sleepy? 
Are your plans to take over the world taking up all your free time? So much to do and so little time? 
We're the same!
Do you dream about squeezing extra hours into your schedule to have fun, relax or work?
So do we! 
Why not do just that with the NeuroOn?
                                         As seen on:
                   What is your dream?
Do you need more energy and to feel well - rested?
Do you want to pack even more into your day?
Do you want to have more control over your day?
Do you hate jet lag?
Do you just need that few extra hours every day?
Do you want to be a hero by day and a superhero by night?
The NeuroOn is for you!
The final prototype
What is polyphasic sleep?
It is a term referring to alternate sleep patterns that can reduce the required sleep time to just 2-6 hours daily. It involves breaking up your sleep into smaller parts throughout the day, which allows you to sleep less but feel as refreshed as if you slept for 8 hours or more.
Polyphasic sleep modes
Simply put, it's a series of fine-tuned power naps that allow you to sleep effectively, rest better and perform at optimum energy levels during the day.
Additionally, NeuroOn monitored polyphasic sleep allows you to sync your body clock to very demanding schedules at whatever time is convenient or required.
In conclusion, through great sleep efficiency, Polyphasic sleep can give you an extra 4 hours of free time every day. That’s up to 28 hours (1 day+) a week, 1460 hours a year. 
That’s right - Your year now has over 420 working days!
Trust the masters
So, you’ve heard of Leonardo? No, not the turtle!
Apparently Da Vinci, Tesla, Churchill and even Napoleon used polyphasic sleep to rest. It allowed them to fully regenerate, reducing sleep time to 6.5 hours or sometimes just 2 hours. And those guys got things done!
Famous polyphasic sleepers
Science that helps you sleep. (Details)
NeuroOn is a wearable sleeping mask that measures your biological signals, including: brain waves (EEG - electroencephalography), muscle tension (EMG - electromyography) and eye movements (EOG - electrooculography).
All the data collected from a user's sleep is transformed from analogue readings to digital analysis and sent via wireless interface fully compliant with Bluetooth 4.0 LE to a smartphone application.
Wiring diagram
When you sleep, you go through two phases: REM and NREM and one follows the other. Using intelligent analysis based on data collected by the NeuroOn, the device will wake you up after your last REM phase, allowing you to feel fully rested and energized.
Data collection and communication
Thanks to the use of the newest technologies we were able to create a device that will improve your effectiveness and concentration at work to the best possible levels. Measurements of EEG, EOG and EMG, coupled with the usage of artificial intelligence, allows us to create the world's first digital sleep-control system that provides accuracy close to professional polisomnographic clinics. It's a whole new level above current, simple solutions that only use accelerometer readings to detect sleep phases. The NeuroOn reads biological signals direct from your body, allowing for super precise and in-depth measurements.
NeuroOn construction
NeuroOn will be powered with the inner battery. It will be rechargeable using micro-USB charger. The battery works for at least 10 days.
PLAY

There’s an app for that!
NeuroOn is managed by a smartphone Android and iOS application so that you have full control over your sleep cycles.
When you are sleeping, the app is working hard to learn your personal sleeping preference and style. Yeah, you’ve got style!
Our intelligent algorithms calculate your individual sleep patterns. The NeuroOn app not only records your sleep data, but also helps you to analyze and optimize your sleep to make sure you enjoy your every waking moment.
Using the app, you can access your complete and personalised data about your sleep and rest at any time.
You can then analyze your data to choose the best sleeping pattern for you, reducing both stress and fatigue.
Oh, and jet lag. Who needs it?
No more of that! With the NeuroOn mask you can manage your sleep and rest whenever and wherever you want - not just when your travel plans make you. You can easily eliminate jet lag and travel without having to recharge after every flight!
Consider turning on Polyphasic sleep mode.
This is supposedly the way Leonardo Da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, Nicola Tesla and, we suspect, Bruce Wayne, used to sleep. Sleep less yet have more energy. Enjoy longer, more efficient days. Sleep a total of just 2 hours a day and let your productivity soar.
With NeuroOn you could sleep/ nap wherever you want.
Am I dreaming? 
The NeuroOn can pinpoint the exact start of your REM phase. NeuroOn has technology that helps you induce lucid dreaming, whenever you want. So you can literally control your dreams.
Dreamy design
We went through dozen of designs, working tirelessly on the look and feel of the NeuroOn.
Product early sketches
It took months to create the final artificial intelligence algorithms, which fit the bill. Today we finally have our working prototype and we’re ready for start manufacturing!
Product early sketches vol. 2
On the inside, we make the NeuroOn from soft, comfortable materials with the ability to adjust to your face, thanks to the use of viscoelastic foams - the latest version of memory foam.
Product early sketches vol. 3
The outside of the mask is fully customizable with various designs, including your own designs, so you can sleep in style.
Evolution of PCB
To receive bioelectrical signals we use the electrodes created from electroconductive dry materials. Our electrodes are not going to co-operate with traditional EEG or ECG machines because of their high resistance and high level of contact potential difference. A substantial problem is the sizeable difference of resistances between the couples of electrodes in one canal.

PCB version 1.0
 That's why we decided to build a dedicated and extraordinary biological amplifier which manages measurements perfectly in adverse conditions. With the aid of our original construction there is no need to humidify electrodes before using them. It's enough to put your finger on the surface and you'll see smooth ECG signal. If you want to see EEG waveform simply apply electrodes to your forehead, it's easy as that!
PCB version 2.0
PCB version 2.1
PCB version 2.2 under construction
Attached below are the waveforms of ECG, EEG and EOG signals registered by our team. When you look at the spectrogram you can easily see the level of particular componential frequencies which distinguish relaxation state from the concentration state that are followed one by one in 15 second intervals. When a person is focused on solving a task and his or her frontal lobe is activated, a major action of faster beta waves occurs in the band above 16 Hz. In the opposite situation - relaxation state - you can observe lack of the aforementioned activity and an increase in alpha waves’ amplitude 15 sec. after finishing the task.
ECG signal (chest)
ECG signal (fingers)
EOG (eye movements)
EEG (brainwaves during the concentration)
One of the main features of our biological amplifier is an ability to change parameters of its own analogue track. During profiling the signals it can easily switched from tracking high-amplitude signals (like the ECG) to the lower ones (like brain waves) in the suitable moment. There's no black box magic in it, only pure and advance engineering and our original patents. Not to mention that our device is fully safe and energy-saving, it can work steady one week without charging regardless of what power (battery or accumulator) you will use.
Sleep safe
The electronics at the heart of the NeuroOn provide the highest precision of sleep measuring. Crucially, for the user's safety, data is only transmitted when the mask is not touching the user's face. Data transmission to the smartphone only occurs when you take the mask off in the morning.
Sleeping with NeuroOn is comfortable in every position.
When you rest, it’s a comfortable sleeping mask. When you wake up, it becomes a superhero mask, setting you up for whatever lies ahead.
Colorful foams
The competition? They must be dreaming!
NeuroOn provides a whole new level of sleep monitoring and optimization. All the other smartphone apps and sleeping solutions currently available, that claim to analyze and help you sleep efficiently, rely purely on accelerometer readings.
Your every twist and turn affects the “sleep analysis” and can completely nullify all the data collected.
Accelerometer is less precise than biological signal processing
Only the NeuroOn analyzes your movement, your eye movement and your brainwaves all together for super accurate and reliable readings. Using an accelerometer alone is like using one note to compose a symphony.
Current prototype (the backside view)
Current prototype (the frontside view)
The President of Poland - our Honorable #001 User
PLAY

  We were given an opportunity to pitch NeuroOn for the most influential people of Poland, including the President. He loved our product and devoted almost half the duration of his speech to it, eager to learn more. We were truly honored to present a NeuroOn mask (formerly ‘Zizz’) to the President, who became our first user!


Kamil Adamczyk is handing over the smart sleep mask to the President
Know who you’re getting into bed with
We’ve always dreamt about great technology and our passion is the human brain – eminent and inscrutable. We have all chosen our unique areas of study independently in varying fields, but we’ve combined our expertise to create an incredible product.
Kamil Adamczyk pitch at Ennovation conference
Knowing more about the brain (undoubtedly the most important and fascinating part of the human body) is something we will definitely want to achieve. We want to know it better, reach deeper and create new technologies to change both the world we live in and your lives!

We are Ogden Made
Ogden, Utah is a place full of tradition, history and a lot of grit. We've created a line of versatile, rugged bags inspired by our hometown and made in America.
Who We Are and How We Got Here
We know bags. Our team has been making industry-leading backpacks and shoulder bags for the photographic industry for years. Our existing products are designed, tested and sold from our HQ in Ogden, Utah, and sewn in Vietnam.
Nearly six months ago, we started sketching some new bags just for us, based on things we wanted in our everyday lives. We discovered creating these bags in our own sewing room was fun, and we love being able to touch and feel the process from inspiration to execution. Our bags are made one at a time and imbued with our passion for functional, clean designs. This made us think...
We looked around our community and saw an opportunity - to create local jobs and products to help shape the future of Ogden. We took an empty room, filled it with a few state-of-the-art sewing machines and found talented Ogden locals with a passion for well-crafted goods. We codenamed the project 'Ogden Made™'. 
Awesome bags Made in Ogden, USA. Each one signed and dated by the person who made it. We've done the hard part by investing in equipment and finding talented craftspeople. Now we need your support to make Ogden Made a reality!  We are turning to Kickstarter to fund the first run of production of our bags.
The Products
Ogden's history, culture, people and buildings continually inspire us. Ogden is a town with hidden prohibition-era speakeasies, magnificent art deco buildings contrasted against rugged mountains, and a can-do spirit when faced with long odds. That's our inspiration. So when we began naming our products, we naturally looked to that tradition to lead the way.
The Junction City™ Messenger
Our signature bag carries Ogden's nickname, the Junction City. Ogden is at the crossroads of the US rail system - we even have a golden spike to prove it. There was an old saying that to get anywhere you had to go to Ogden first. Reflecting our city's rugged and plainspoken lifestyle, the Junction City Messenger is made from equally durable and rugged CORDURA® 1000D fabric to ensure it stands up to your toughest challenges.
The Junction City is a messenger with grit and grace. Each bag is carefully handcrafted with tried and trusted CORDURA® and/or our custom X-Pac™ ripstop fabric and an obsessive amount of pride. To work, to play, or to the other side of the globe, the Junction City will carry your essentials with unpretentious style. 
The Junction City Messenger is available in two sizes
Small fits up to 11" MacBook in Transient sleeve
Medium fits up to 15" MacBook in Transient sleeve
Key Feature Overview
Constructed from tough 1000D CORDURA® 
Large exterior pocket with key hook and water-resistant YKK® zipper
Pockets wide enough for a iPad, Kindle, or book
Smaller pockets with dividers for pens, pencils, phone and other small items
Secure velcro closure keeps all your stuff inside the bag
Integrated buckles and straps helps keep everything secure
Quick adjusting 2” webbing strap with shoulder pad (Customizable for left or right shoulder)
It's available in two sizes, medium and small. The medium is large enough to fit a 15” MacBook in one of our Transient Sleeves, plus everything you need to get through your busy day while the small is large enough to fit an 11” MacBook in a Transient Sleeve, plus your lunch and a jacket. The front pockets are designed for an iPad Mini or if most other small tablets.
Medium Junction City Messenger:
Exterior Dimensions 20” x 12” x 6”
Interior Dimensions 10” to 18” x 11” x 5 3/4”

The Transient™ Tablet & Laptop Sleeves
Ogden is as much about the folks who traveled through as those who stayed and called it home. Throughout WWII, soldiers came to Ogden on their way to training, deployment and home. And as a result, a good portion of Ogden's history and vitality came from those just passing through - the transients.
If you are anything like us, your technology travels with you for both work and fun. We designed our Transient Tablet and Laptop Sleeves to look equally comfortable at the office on Monday morning as they are all weekend in the mountains. Transients are designed to protect your technology from the everyday bumps and scrapes without being complicated or pretentious. 
Exterior Construction: Tough & protective X-Pac™ laminated fabric and 1000D CORDURA®
Interior Lining: Soft & cushioned custom-made quilting (50D soft nylon facing with a 6 oz polyester fill backing)
Strategically placed and hidden velcro closure holds your technology in place
Sized to fit: iPad Mini®, iPad 2®, iPad Air™, 11” MacBook Air®, 13” MacBook Air, 13” MacBook Pro® or 15” MacBook Pro
The Boxcar™ Dopp Kit
The Boxcar is inspired by the Dopp kit, a fixture of first class train travel and eventually issued to every GI coming through Ogden in WWII. Almost 100 years ago, Charles Doppelt was somewhere in a bathroom fumbling for a place to store his straight razor and horsehair brush. In 1919 he introduced the Dopp kit into the world and things have never been the same. We’d like to think Mr. Doppelt would be pleased with our rendition of his ingenious product.
Shaped like a Union Pacific boxcar and just as roomy, the Boxcar Dopp Kit holds your shaving kit or other stuff like power blocks and cables just as easily. 
Shaving cream and toothpaste-proof X-Pac laminated fabric bottom
1000D CORDURA® fabric top
Water-resistant YKK zippers
Webbing handle for hanging or carrying
External Dimensions: 8 1/2” l X 4 1/4”w X 2 3/4” h
The Divide™ Accessory Cases
Ogden is nestled on the western side of the Wasatch Mountains. The North Ogden Divide is a beautiful mountain pass with amazing views of the Great Salt Lake, Ogden and northern Utah. We named our accessory pouches in honor of this gorgeous pass over the mountains.
Designed to carry all the flotsam that comes with your daily life, the Divide Series of cases come in three sizes and two styles. The Twisted Divide is a pencil case with a quirk that allows it to lay flat when full and expand when you open it to see all the goodies it carries. Both of the Flat Divide cases hold every little thing for your day's adventures - pens, ear buds and power cords all tucked away and tidy. They all fit a standard Apple power block and are constructed with our custom X-Pac™, 1000D CORDURA® accents and a water-resistant YKK zipper. 
Tough as nails 1000D CORDURA® and custom X-Pac™ construction
Water-resistant YKK zippers
Each are 8 1/2” wide in varying lengths from 4” to 8”.
Available Colors
We've put together a palette of CORDURA® colors we love:  Beehive Yellow, Mandarin Orange, Firehouse Red, Sky Blue, Beach Sand and Moonlight Silver (yeah, we like fancy names for colors).  Plus our custom X-Pac™ comes in Black.   All the colors are available in all our products.
For the Junction City Messengers we pair an exterior color with a contrasting bright interior so you can see what is in bottom of your bag.   You may choose your favorite colors for any of our rewards.   We have several favorite color combinations for the Junction City Messengers:
 - Silver exterior with Red or Sky Blue interior and accents
- Sand exterior with Orange or Sky Blue interior and accents
- X-Pac™ Black exterior with Sand, Silver or Blue interior and accents
Sketch, Sew, Refine, Design Complete
We started with an idea that we could build a bag for ourselves that was simple and elegant, yet tough. Sketches filled our notebooks. Our office white board was written on, erased and written on again and again. All the while we were creating bags in the sewing room. 
The first bag from our sewing room was olive drab green and pretty rough.  But it was a starting point.  From there we spent the next six months sewing prototypes and arguing over details like zipper direction and buckle selection. We asked our friends to test our prototypes and adjusted the pocket configuration and strap style in response to their feedback.  We found that paper prototypes helped us check the size, shape and concept of our bags.  And then we got back to sewing.
As our messenger bag came together we realized several things: shortcuts are for nincompoops and don't result in inspired design. Quality construction takes patience and skill. So we ditched the idea of binding the interior lining to the exterior of the bag in favor of sewing the two together, laboriously turning them inside out and letting the interior and exterior become their own finished edges with a color matched top stitch. It's definitely not easier, but it's simply better. We then created our own custom CORDURA® binding for any exposed edges like pockets. Does this take longer and cost more? Sure thing, but it results in a clean functional design that we love.
Our accessory cases and sleeves took the same path as the development of our messenger bags.   We started with what we wanted to carry in each accessory and translated that into sewn prototypes that were tested and refined, argued over and sized up and sized down until we got it right.
We knew the materials had to be right. Again, no shortcuts. This meant working with our suppliers to develop a new material as well as relying on materials that have proven themselves over time. Costs have never been the driving force behind our material choices. That would be like serving ramen on a yacht. We're not about that.
We chose a fabric from CORDURA® that's tough as nails and looks and handles well.  Not only does CORDURA® 1000D have decades of real world proven durability but is also made and sourced in America. We then worked with one of our favorite American mills to produce a custom version of our favorite fabric, X-Pac™.  Our X-Pac™ RS has a ripstop facing that resists tears and specialized PU coating that is water-resistant with a taffeta lining for beauty and durability.  Bottom line, it's awesome.
Choose Your Reward
Fulfillment Plan
Our in-house sewing production facility will handle all bag and accessory production and fulfillment for this Kickstarter project and beyond.  We've found talented craftspeople who have been intimately involved in the prototyping phase of our project so they know how to sew each one of the products we make.  
We have accumulated an inventory of fabric and the other necessary materials to produce a limited amount of our product. In addition, we have established relationships with several suppliers so that we can easily replenish fabric and other material inventory as needed.  All patterns are made and final materials have been selected and sourced.
As soon as our Kickstarter project funds we will begin production on all Early Bird Specials.  We have specifically limited the number of Early Bird Specials to what our current capacity can produce and ship within a few days.  All other rewards will be placed on our production calendar for completion, quality control and shipment by the end of February. Should this project blow up, we have cultivated contacts with reliable contractors with whom we have worked before who will provide back up sewing production capabilities.

campaign.story:
When we began to work on the new Thylacine™ line, we considered every element that defines a great sleeping bag – silky soft lightweight fabrics, advanced insulation technologies, body-mapped patterning, 3D construction, durable hardware, snag free zippers, and beautifully functional form.  We pushed through boundaries set by the “status quo” and kept challenging ourselves to create the best, most innovative sleeping bag possible.  After years of iterations, the result was something revolutionary - a redefinition of what a sleeping bag should be.
The predominate theme for designing the Thylacine™ is extremely simple: Give Power to the People! Our goal is to give you the most functionality & versatility in one sleeping bag system. Period. You get to choose the best customized sleeping bag set up for every adventure. Our mission is to design products for your life-changing adventures, and we know your adventures are always changing!  
The Thylacine™ adapts to your specific needs, and delivers endless options to unleash your creativity as you interact with the natural world. The Thylacine can become any bag you need it to be due to its patent-pending Variable Warmth Technology™ (interchangeable baffle system) and Customfit™ size adjustments.
Variable Warmth Technology™ delivers complete customization through a system of changeable insulated baffles. The baffles can be filled with synthetic, down, or a hybrid of both types of insulation. Although baffles are common in most sleeping bags, the ability to remove and change the baffles is an entirely new concept specifically designed to meet the needs of every adventure. 
The Thylacine uses a patent-pending locking feature that keeps the baffles properly positioned inside the baffle chamber to prevent cold spots. The baffles are created using an ultralight downproof fabric that is quilted in order to minimize the migration of insulation. By simply removing or adding baffles to the baffle chambers, you can create the customized temperature rating you need for whatever adventure awaits you.  
Example:
"Our first night in Patagonia was spent in the valley of El Chalten where the temperature reached a low of around 40°F. One layer of synthetic baffles created a 40°F bag and kept us warm. However, a 25°F bag would have been uncomfortably hot! The second night we made camp near the glacier where the cold wind came down off glacier. The lowest temperature that night was around 20°F - and it was sleeting/windy. By simply adding a second layer of baffles in each chamber, we created a 25°F bag. Another layer of synthetic baffles would bring the rating to 0°F. In owning the Thylacine bag with three layers of baffles, you actually have 4 complete sleeping bags in one!" - Greg McEvilly
PrimaLoft® Gold Synthetic is the highest performing insulation on the market for warmth, water resistance, softness and compressibility. PrimaLoft® Gold is an ultra-fine microfiber insulation that is as soft, lightweight, and warmer, wet or dry, than all other insulations. Ultra-fine fibers form tiny air pockets to trap body heat and keep the cold out. The result is immediate warmth without the bulk. PrimaLoft® Gold microfibers are engineered for permanent water resistance and create tight surface tension that resists moisture penetration, resulting in an insulation that dries faster than goose down. Ultra-fine fibers mimic the compressibility of goose down and are breathable, allowing moisture to be transported through the fibers and away from the skin. 
PrimaLoft® Down Blend is the ultimate combination of PrimaLoft® ultra-fine fibers and water repellent goose down, offering high-performance warmth and comfort in variable conditions while adhering to the PrimaLoft® promise of an environmentally safe technology free of fluorocarbons.
PrimaLoft® Down Blend Gold is a unique blend of premium quality environmentally friendly water resistant 750 fill power grey goose down with PrimaLoft® ultra-fine denier fibers.  Our hybrid insulated baffles feature a homogeneous blend of 30% PrimaLoft® ultra-fine fibers, and 70% of 750 fill power water resistant goose down. This combines the benefits of both worlds - offering the absolute best of Down & Synthetic in one fill type.
These width adjustments allows the you to modify the size of the bag as needed. The footbed adjustment allows the bag length to be resized 3" - 5" inches so that your feet are all the way down in the bag. Five body width adjustments allow you to customize the width of the bag at several critical points: chest, hips, thighs, knees and ankles. This allows for less dead space and increases thermal efficiency and comfort for the user.
Atmos™ is a 10D nylon ripstop made from high tenacity yarns offering unprecedented durability with thermal reflective properties.
One of the biggest challenges in creating an adaptable sleeping bag is managing the overall weight of the bag due to the necessary use of additional fabrics for encasing interchangeable baffles. To achieve a lightweight design, we had to look at making a new ultralight fabric with integrated thermal retention technology.
This problem forced us to think differently about fabric – the Thylacine “shell” and “liner” fabric needed to be multifunctional and offer greater thermal retention value than traditional ultralight fabrics. Increasing the thermal retention value of the fabric allows the use of less insulating “fill” in the interchangeable baffles – driving down total weight in a radical way.
Atmos™ is incredibly soft against the skin, and is used as the “liner” fabric for the Thylacine Ultralight™ and Thylacine Expedition™ bags. Atmos+™ DWR is treated with a Durable Water Repellent finish, and is used as the Ultralight bag shell fabric.
The newest textile development in Kammok’s amphibious class is DART™ – which stands for Dry Advanced Respiration Technology.  DART™ fabric is used for the Expedition bag shell & offers some of the most waterproof & breathable advancements on the market.  DART™ is powered by eVent® - a patented waterproof membrane that allows vapor to vent from inside the bag while keeping wind and water out.  
eVent® fabrics get their unique properties from a proprietary and patented waterproof membrane. Its unique composition allows millions of tiny pores to breathe at their full potential. Most common waterproof/breathable membranes do not literally “breathe.” Instead, they move sweat in two slow steps by a process of diffusion through a Polyurethane (PU) layer. Because a PU absorbs and retains sweat, the inside of the fabric becomes wet. Body heat begins to push the dampness through to the outside of the fabric where it can finally evaporate–a very inefficient process. eVent is the most advanced breathable & waterproof membrane available today!
The Thylacine Ultralight™ and Expedition™ shells are uninsulated (when baffles are removed) sleeping bags, similar to a liner, but with all the features of a sleeping bag.  With the baffles removed, the Ultralight can be a summer degree bag, and the Expedition “X” shell can be an uninsulated waterproof bivy - both can be reconfigured as needed.  
Super Ultralight sleeping bag shell that compresses into a softball sized stuff sack (uninsulated). The Thylacine UL™ sleeping bag shell features Kammok’s proprietary Atmos+™ fabric with heat reflective technology and a DWR finish. The UL liner is made of Atmos™ - giving a silky soft feel. The Thylacine UL also features a waterproof footbox.
The Thylacine X™ is a waterproof bivy/sleeping bag featuring Kammok’s DART™ Technology. DART™ (Dry Advanced Respiration Technology) is an eVent based fabric is that is Waterproof, Windproof, and highly Breathable. The Thylacine X will be fully seam sealed for ultimate waterproofness and also features Atmos™ fabric for the liner.
Unlike traditional sleeping bags, the Thylacine Sleeping Bag System also allows you to easily wash and maintain your bag. Typically, when a sleeping bag needs to be washed, it is because the shell and liner are dirty, not the inner insulation. Thanks to Thylacine’s removable baffles, the sleeping bag shell and the baffles can be washed and treated separately. This allows you to properly clean dirt and body oils from the shell and liner without compromising the insulating properties of the baffles.
The Thylacine line will undergo multiple certified lab tests which will evaluate the thermal performance of the sleeping bag according to EN 13537 requirements for Sleeping Bags (CEN, 2012).  Specifically, the Thylacine will be tested to determine the measured insulation values and the temperature limits that will determine the temperature comfort range.  
We will work diligently to achieve these temperature ratings, and share the testing results in Project Status Updates.
The Thylacine Sleeping Bag System allows for future customizations including internal head pillows, internal sleeping pads, and many other advancements in future insulation - further example of how and why this is the only sleeping bag system you will ever need to own! 
The best trail rated quilt ever produced, the Firebelly™ fuses luxurious comfort & technical back country functionality. Designed specifically for hammock users and the ultra-minimalist backpacker, the Firebelly™ places all insulation on the sides & top of you and omits the bottom insulation (bottom insulation is often unusable when compressed in a hammock or when a sleeping pad is used). The Firebelly™ will be rated at ± 30°F, keeping you incredibly warm at a 'feather-light' weight.
The Firebelly™ can be used as a traditional bed quilt when unbuttoned, or you can choose to secure the 5 button snaps and draw cord at the foot area to create a cosy warm foot box. When not in use on the trail, the Firebelly may be replacing Granny’s old quilt on your couch!
The Firebelly™ is now available on the right for $125 (WILL RETAIL FOR $250.00 = $125 IN PRE-MARKET SAVINGS!)

campaign.story:
"The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure. The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun.” 
― Christopher McCandless
THE MISSION 
To create a photo story book that portrays inspiring stories of wanderers, travelers and nomads from all over the world. 
To inspire people to travel, explore, get out of their comfort zones, and create their own paths.
THE STORYTELLER
Hello, I'm Stephanie. A photographer, writer, travel blogger, also known as Satori.

Two years ago, I opted out of college. I quit my job. And decided to create my own path. All I had ever wanted was to travel the world, take pictures, tell stories and inspire others. So I chose to do just that. I traveled to places in Central America and Asia. I was living nomadically with nothing but a backpack. I felt liberated. There were life-changing lessons I learned on the road I would have never learned through a book, a classroom, or a degree. The world has so much to teach us if we're brave enough to explore the unknown and leap into it with open arms. And it's all waiting for us at the other end of the flight.

I created a blog called InfiniteSatori.org to document my journey and inspire other people along the ride. As my blog grew, my audience grew with it. I've received so many messages from people who have been inspired by my blog to the point where they started following their bliss and traveling the world.

I was so happy that I made an impact in their lives. If one story like mine can inspire many, imagine what a whole book can do? Traveling opens us up to the world, our true selves and our life's purpose. Imagine if people gained the courage to leave their unfulfilling lives to travel the world, the journeys they will embark upon, and the many dreams that will come alive. This notion lights up my soul. And all I can think of is creating this special book.
THE BOOK 
Sample of the hardcover photo book from Artifact Uprising
Sample of softcover photo book from Artifact Uprising
I'm partnering with friends at Artifact Uprising to create the limited-edition Kickstarter version of this beautifully bound book. All other rewards will be created through Artifact Uprising as well.
Artifact Uprising is a print company inspired by the disappearing beauty of the tangible and is a community of inspired storytellers. They are driven by the belief everyone has a story to tell. I couldn't find a more perfect company to collaborate with on this project. The book, including all other rewards are made from Mohawk Options 100% post consumer recycled paper. FSC Certified. Acid free. Manufactured with wind power.

THE JOURNEY
 I'm setting out on a quest. I will backpack by myself all throughout Indonesia, Thailand, Laos, Cambodia, Burma, Cambodia, Malaysia, Philippines, India & Nepal. I will find The Wanderers. This could be anyone from backpackers, to gypsies, to homeless nomads, to vagabonding families, to the holy men of India, to Bajau the sea gypsies of the Philippines, the the Moken nomads of Thailand who were displaced by the 2004 tsunami, to the wandering Hindu monks of Nepal. I will immerse myself into their lives, connect with them, photograph them, capture the essence of their beings, the essence of their lives. I will capture the human experience. 

Every wanderer has an incredible story to tell, it just needs a little light. I truly feel that with all their stories, this book has the power to inspire the wanderer that resides in all of us. It will help give people the courage to get out of their comfort zones and live their dreams of traveling the world.
Once this project is successfully funded, I will be on the road for at least six months. No specific plans, just the skeleton of a journey and let serendipity work its magic. I'll live as cheap as possible and stay at hostels, couch surf, and live on the bare minimum I need to travel throughout the journey. 

If anything resonates within you, if anything about this illuminates your soul and gives you goosebumps. Follow it and support this project. We are much more interconnected than we will ever know. This project isn't solely mine. It's for you. It's for the wanderer that resides in all of us.

THE PHOTOGRAPHY
 Click to see portfolio


THE REWARDS
Postcards from Artifact Uprising
5x5 square print set from Artifact Uprising
Hardcover books from Artifact Uprising
                                                      THE MOVEMENT
This is more than just a book. Together, we are creating a movement. A movement that will inspire many. Traveling has a way of opening ourselves up to the world, discovering who we're meant to be, what we're meant to do, travel has created revelations and epiphanies that altered the course of history such as Che Guevara traveling in a motorbike all over South America and Charles Darwin in the Galapagos Islands. I believe that the book, this movement will inspire people to get out of their comfort zones, create their own paths and live their lives with passion, meaning, and adventure.
FUNDING 
$20,000 is based on the absolute bare minimum I would need for this project. It includes travel expenses such as plane tickets, accommodation, food and transportation. Half of the funding will go towards the production and shipment of the rewards, the book reward is the Kickstarter limited-edition of the book. If there is extra left it will go towards any costs of publishing the final book. The other half will be used for my travels. Kickstarter and Amazon charges a total of 10% from the funds, so I will be left with 8,000 for travel. That would leave me at more or less 2,000-3,000 for plane tickets to and around Asia. And so I will be left with 5,000 to stretch as living expenses for as long as I can until I feel that my documentation and stories of The Wanderers are complete. This could take anywhere in between six months to a year. And I am willing to live as cheaply as I possibly can. I will not be staying in fancy hotels, or living lavishly. I never do. I will be staying at the cheapest hostels, couch surfing, camping, sleeping in god knows where, eating the cheapest street food, etc. This budget is just the bare minimum that I would need.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I will be traveling solo on this quest to bring the wanderers together so bear with me if any setbacks arises. As my supporters, I know you will understand gracefully. 

I will work hard as I go, updating the blog, posting up pictures of each wanderer I connect with, sending rewards throughout the journey and sending the book to all you amazing people once it is finalized. 

Note that this is not just a vacation for me. I will go through lengths to find stories, to find The Wanderers and to bring this book to life. And that requires a huge amount of my effort into this project on a daily basis, most especially while I am on the journey.

After my journey I'll settle somewhere in Asia for a couple months to work on the book and get everything sent out to my backers as promised. With the support of some of my peers who I trust and love, we will produce the rewards in a timely manner.

I'm very passionate about this project. And when I'm extremely passionate about something, I work hard and focus on producing the best final product. My vision has never been more clear. I will do everything I can to make this project come to life. 

So I will do my best to give you the most compelling stories. The most beautiful images. And one incredibly inspiring book. Together, I believe with every cell of me, that we can make this happen.

Using an iPhone wallet isn't always pretty. That's why we set out to create a secure, wallet solution with a slim and streamline design to fit all walks of life. By focusing on every detail, such as fit, finish, functionality, and aesthetics, we’ve created a protective wallet solution in a class of its own. From the audible click-closure access drawer to our patent pending push and slide release system, we have gone above and beyond to transform the iPhone wallet into a secure, discreet, and stylish everyday solution.
Push doesn't use elastic bands, pull-tabs, or bulky hinges. Other smartphone-wallets loudly display your cash & cards on the back of your phone-where over time they can even fall out. Shake it as hard as you can or drop it, Push can handle it. Push's front-facing wallet offers unrivaled security because your cards cannot fall out given any situation. This gives you the confidence that your essentials are completely concealed, safe, and secure no matter where you go and for your eyes only.
Push is treated with a high-quality easy grip surface, giving it an elegant and fashionable finish with a smooth touch feel. The White Glacier, Pink Passion and all Artist series models come glossy with artwork professionally printed by an industrial sublimation service (the identical method & quality used by the highest end cases sold in Best Buy and Apple stores)
Get in the fast lane and gain the rewards of saving time and space.
You see it more and more everyday. Smartphone wallets are on the rise, and for obvious reasons. Just like the way of the camera, calculator, notepad, calendar, and even our mailbox. Smartphones continue to absorb the most useful parts of our day and pack them all into your phone, keeping all those things right at your fingertips. Shift your paradigm to a simplified lifestyle and upgrade to Push for your iPhone 5S, 5C and iPhone 5. Never leave home without it, and never lose track of your wallet again because the next time you leave it in the car, or at home on the nightstand, there's no need for panic, now-a-days you just call it & GPS track it.
On the back, there is a button. Press and slide the button up (toward the top of your iPhone) to instantly access your cash, credit cards, business cards, ID.
Place whichever contents you wish into Push’s front-facing wallet compartment and simply slide it back in. When the storage tray reaches its final position, an Automatic Locking mechanism is activated, letting you flow through your day knowing that all of your essentials are locked inside, safe and secure.
Push tags along wherever you go. For work, a workout, at school, on vacation, or another night out. Leave your wallet or clutch behind.
Push is versatile and fits any occasion
Push fits 3 cards or 2 cards + cash
Push makes an impression on everyone as it's the ONLY protective case that offers a premium look with a unique user experience
Easy Access to all ports
Both the headset port lightning connector are easily accessible
We are technology entrepreneurs and prototyping enthusiast who care about what we design and build, especially the relationships that come along with building something as user-friendly as Push. We started building Push for fun about year ago. It began as a quest to make the ultimate wallet which quickly led to a the ultimate smartphone wallet because using one allows you the freedom of carrying one less thing--and that fits into everyone's schedule. We set out to design a wallet that would carry us through the entire day without ever reaching into an extra pocket or purse. We knew it had to look slim and feel great. We were tired of awful wallet solution (i.e. bulky or a pain to use). Many prototypes and iterations later, we've arrived at the ultimate grab-n-go wallet solution that we know you're going to love.
